page.title: 12FAUNA & FLORA OF GREETE CONT
page.content: Along the banks of the streams there are water voles, while damsel flies, dragon flies, and mayflies dance above the water. A few ponds still have a population of newts, toads and frogs in the spring. On the tops of the higher knolls, bracken abounds, providing cover for a variety of mammals and birds, and in open patches, there are knapweeds, harebells, and fleabanes. In valleys which are not tilled, Dyers Greenweed, and spotted orchid can be found, whilst in one or two fields which have been left unploughed, the meadow saffron still grows. Where weedkillers have not been used,(rare) a few poppies are evident, and curlews and peewits return to breed each year. Moles are abundant and hares can be seen in March. CONTINUED ON NEXT PAGE
